data.title: Brussels-Midi railway station
data.meta_description: Find information about Brussels-Midi/Zuid Station, including facilities, public transport and international train connections. Read more at SNCB International.
data.text:
International platforms: 1 – 2 (Eurostar trains to/from London), 3 to 6 (Eurostar trains between Belgium, France, Germany, the Netherlands, TGV INOUI and ICE trains)

Ticket offices and travel information: in the main concourse and next to the international platforms

Find out more about international ticket offices at Brussels-Midi >

Eurostar check-in: for travel to Great Britain, check-in takes place in the Channel Terminal in the main concourse; for travel to Lille and Calais, check-in is in the Intra-Schengen terminal, on the first level, mezzanine, near the Place Horta entrance

Find out more about the Eurostar check-in

Facilities: Wi-Fi (paying), toilets and baggage storage

Shops and bars

Check all facilities provided at any station in Belgium >

Brussels-Midi has a wide range of facilities for passengers with reduced mobility: lifts and escalators to all platforms, wheelchair lifts and mobile ramps, disabled toilet and parking spaces.

A dedicated assistance service can be contacted

via the SNCB Mobility Call Centre on +32 2 607 30 00, 7 days a week, 7.00 – 21.00

via the online assistance request form >

Please pre-book mobility assistance at least 24 hours prior to departure for international travel to or from Belgium. For assistance abroad on journeys beginning or ending outside Belgium, please contact the appropriate train company in the appropriate country.

We recommend that passengers who would like wheelchair spaces on board trains reserve them under their own names prior to travel.

More information on assistance for mobility-impaired passengers >

There are several parking options around Brussels-Midi/Zuid Station:

Indoor, pay and display car park beneath Place Victor Horta with direct access to the station (Rue de France entrance: Rue de France 40; Tour du Midi entrance: Rue Ernest Blerot 1). Open 24/7. More information and online reservation: Gare du Midi car park >

On street parking: Pay and display between 09.00 and 18.00. Spaces are available in the surrounding streets (Esplanade de l'Europe, Avenue Paul-Henri Spaak, corner of Avenue Fonsny and Boulevard du Midi).

Bicycle parking: Avenue Fonsny and Place Victor Horta. Spaces specifically designated for bicycles are free.

Kiss & Ride: passenger drop-off opposite the Tour du Midi (parking prohibited).
